Spring Framework
  1. org.springframework.test.context.bean.override
  2. BeanOverride

Uses of Annotation Interface
org.springframework.test.context.bean.override.BeanOverride

Packages that use BeanOverride
Package
Description
org.springframework.test.context.bean.override.convention
Bean override mechanism based on conventionally-named static methods in the test class.
org.springframework.test.context.bean.override.mockito
Bean overriding mechanism based on Mockito mocking and spying.

  • Uses of BeanOverride in org.springframework.test.context.bean.override.convention

    Classes in org.springframework.test.context.bean.override.convention with annotations of type BeanOverride
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    @interface 
    TestBean
    @TestBean is an annotation that can be applied to a non-static field in a test class to override a bean in the test's ApplicationContext using a static factory method.

  • Uses of BeanOverride in org.springframework.test.context.bean.override.mockito

    Classes in org.springframework.test.context.bean.override.mockito with annotations of type BeanOverride
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    @interface 
    MockitoBean
    @MockitoBean is an annotation that can be used in test classes to override a bean in the test's ApplicationContext with a Mockito mock.
    @interface 
    MockitoSpyBean
    @MockitoSpyBean is an annotation that can be used in test classes to override a bean in the test's ApplicationContext with a Mockito spy that wraps the original bean instance.
